{"step_by_step_thinking": "The question is about the prognosis of patients with allergic contact dermatitis from an occupational cohort. The relevant document that provides information on the follow-up survey of patients with allergic contact dermatitis is 'Occupational dermatitis in a 10-year material'. According to this study, after a 2-3 year follow-up, the eczema was healed in one-quarter of the patients, one-half had periodic symptoms, and one-quarter had permanent symptoms. The prognosis was the same for those who changed their work or stopped working as it was for those who continued their eczema-inducing work. This suggests that the omnipresence of the allergen is not a factor in determining the prognosis.", "answer_choice": "B"}
